title: Drought Tops The List Of Issues In San Diego
teaser: We sit down with three area journalists to talk about the top news stories in the city, from the drought to the Chargers.
contentencoded:
San Diego residents are being asked to reduce their water use dramatically, as the drought dries out the state. Another big issue in the city is whether or not the NFL team, the San Diego Chargers, will stay or leave the city for a new stadium in the Los Angeles area.

Here & Now’s Robin Young is broadcasting from KPBS in San Diego this week, and sits down with three area journalists – Mark Sauer of KPBS, Scott Lewis of Voice of San Diego and Lori Weisberg of the San Diego Union Tribune – to discuss the city’s top news stories.

Guests

  • Mark Sauer, host of the KPBS Roundtable, airing each Friday on radio and TV in San Diego. He tweets @sauerkpbs.
  • Scott Lewis, editor in chief of Voice of San Diego. He tweets @vosdscott.
  • Lori Weisberg, reporter for the UT, the San Diego Union Tribune. She tweets @loriweisberg.
